result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron J Ready

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

AMENDED 9/30/22: Court allows defendant to drive with a valid driver's license between the hours of 7:00 PM and 9:00 AM, 7 days a week, but ONLY for work and AODA treatment purposes.
*All other conditions remain*
Atty Lutgen's Office notified of defendant's requirement to sign an updated bond

11:50 AM Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen appeared by video for Aaron J Ready.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews status of case. Court approves bond modification to include, driving with a valid DL between the hours of 7:00PM and 9:00AM, 7 Days a week, but ONLY for work and AODA treatment. Defendant will need to sign a new bond sheet before the modification goes into effect.

8:35 AM Defendant Aaron J Ready in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Aaron J Ready.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't. Bond motion discussed; Atty Lutgen updates that defendant hours of employment will be changing-asking bond to be modified; def should know change of hours by 9-30. Discussion held-Bond to be modified at upcoming hearing.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 30, 2022 at 11:45 am.
CONDITION ADDED: Defendant allowed to drive ONLY for the purposes of employment and/or to travel to and from work 3AM until 6PM.

8:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron J Ready in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Aaron J Ready. Atty Lutgen heard on Bond Motion; requests change to no driving w/o valid DL. ADA Pack heard; no objection to driving to and from work. Discussion held. Court heard and modifies bond to: Allows Defendant to Drive ONLY for the purposes of employment and/or to travel to and from work from 3AM until 6PM.
Motion hearing on August 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. No driving.

1:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron J Ready appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler (Not Eligible) appeared by video for Aaron J Ready. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1500.00 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. No driving.
Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
